messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:21): Am I the only one who finds it amusing that Shelley Powers complains about multiple venues of discussion in the commenting system of her blog thereby launching yet another venue?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I suggest we all complain/agree about that on our blogs, and get further discussions going there

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:24): also, the notion that the WHATWG list needs to be shut down implies that those who demand it don't trust in the HTML WG list getting enough traction on its own merit

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:27): Maybe they do trust in that, and just don't think the administrative cost of having multiple lists (and hence having to subscribe to them all, and deciding which one to post to, and failing to reach people who are only on one list) is justified by the benefits of keeping both lists

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:30): as it happens, the reasons why the W3C list exists in the first place are the reasons why some people who are on the WHATWG list don't subscribe to the W3C list
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:31): 1) the patent policy shuts out non-appointed employees of Members and 2) getting input from a wider community gets too much input
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:31): although #2 has gotten a lot better lately
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (12:37): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Rather amusingly, 1) basically shuts out employees of ex-members too.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:38): well, perhaps the best solution to this is to shut down both lists and just have discussions on blogs
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (12:38): or Twitter ;)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:38): or on a Wiki
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:38): or multiple Wikis
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:38): whoa. Yahoo! is not on http://www.w3.org/Consortium/Member/List when did that happen?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:38): 0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8: now you're talking :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:38): Decentralisation FTW
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (12:38): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: And that would be the cause of my last comment ;)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:38): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: recently
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:39): wonders if there is a plot of #Members against time
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): I guess Yahoo! is really serious about its need to cut costs.
0c613432f4687d9dae0e13d1af514eb8 (12:44): AFAIK we weren't actually participating in any WGs.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): I get really weird errors from Jing when trying to integrate a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2's patches
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): "Loaded balanced string"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:44): Datatype library ‚Äúhttp://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-datatypes‚Äù not recognized.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:44): I'm good a breaking stuff
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:46): hmm. Jing is loading the datatype sample...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:48): ok. the sample datatype was confusing Jing
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:51): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: btw, have you yet integrated any of your Jing changes into the upstream code?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:51): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: onto the branch
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:52): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: now it's up to James Clark to pick stuff onto the trunk
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: if the trunk gains all the functionality I need, I'll switch to the trunk
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:54): cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:54): James seems to have gone quiet again
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (13:11): hello, is there an html5 help room, or is this it?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: hey there. Long time no hear from you
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): this is the right place
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): or #html-wg on the W3C server
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): or your own blog, if you prefer
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:13): if it's a complaint, though, the preference is definitely that you complain on your own blog or someone else's
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:13): or on multiple blogs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:14): IRC ranting is acceptable too I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:14): as long as you link to it from a blog
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:14): and easier than writing a whole post :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:14): heh
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:15): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: linking to IRC rants from a blog is automatically outsourced
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): mr last week ^^
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:16): yep, yeay for that. nobody could complain that we aren't collectively doing everything we can to enable them to complain more easily
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:16): one big happy family
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:17): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: btw, wonder if you have heard any get details about the WebKit version on the new Palm WebOS thingey
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:17): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: also, if you have something you really need help with or info about, please don't let my nonsense distract you
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (13:18): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I have left the world of dotmobi behind, so i'm a little out of touch with the mobile web biznez
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:18): ah, OK
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:19): you landed somewhere else already, or have you become a gentleman of leisure?
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (13:19): have landed in a wee web company, 'tis fun
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:20): cool
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (13:21): though if i was still with dotmobi i'd be getting paid in euro, not sterling...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): ooh, sterling is bad these days
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): is happy Opera now pays him in EUR instead of NOK
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:22): sterling, what is that? Pirate money, like doubloons?
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (13:24): doubloons would be good, her majesty's nuggets not so much

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:56): the WHATWG will absorb, and their operational modus is capricious at best.

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:56): http://simon.html5.org/tools/js/coords-parsing.html

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:00): i noticed that some characters aren't "fatal" in ie but are in html5, like linebreaks or ¬¥
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:01): there are some characters that ie treat like the spec treats "."

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:08): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%0D%0A%3Cmap%3E%3Carea%20shape%3D%22circle%22%3E%3C%2Fmap%3E%0D%0A%3Cscript%3E%0D%0Avar%20a%20%3D%20document.getElementsByTagName('area')%5B0%5D%3B%0D%0Afor%20(var%20i%20%3D%201%3B%20i%20%3C%200x3ff%3B%20%2B%2Bi)%20%7B%0D%0A%20%20a.coords%20%3D%20'1'%20%2B%20String.fromCharCode(i)%20%2B%20'2%2C3'%3B%0D%0A%20%20w('0x'%20%2B%20i.toString(16)%20%2B%20'%20('%20%2B%20String.fr
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:08): or http://tinyurl.com/9s7mb3

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (14:14): cos all implementers actaully need is a clear spec to implement

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:34): http://intertwingly.net/blog/2009/01/09/Mime-Sniff :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:34): sverrej!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:43): <area alt="UNESCO" title="UNESCO" coords="rect:0,0,110,90" href="http://www.unesco.org">
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:52): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: http://philip.html5.org/data/coords-with-unusual-chars.txt
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:09): (I hope you don't care about non-double-quoted attributes)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:11): not really, although the data contains some noise (e.g. i don't care about  89.0,19.0,89.0...)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:12): "615, 0, 768, 40 " (with tab at the end) parses differently
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:13): "2,20', 87,38'" differently
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:15): I left that noise in since it was rare enough to be easy to ignore when reading the output, and since I wanted to see how common non-integers were
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:27): so 3 pages break with the html5 algorithm, out of 130k
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:28): i guess that's acceptable, but otoh those pages work in today's browsers and it's easy to change the algorithm
fefe4c60d912e295e59fd874577ca7f9 (15:29): what are these pages that break?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:30): http://www.psu.edu/ur/GSpanier/gallery/
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:30): http://www.motorsportforbundet.no/
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:30): http://www.kipwmi.com/
1c32249ea47a56f145a75349f2b0426a (15:32): makes Opera pretend certain <a href="javascript:;"> links in hotmail have "aNewWindow='true'" attributes.
1c32249ea47a56f145a75349f2b0426a (15:46): admires the obsession with detail in the "requirements of Japanese typography" document

1c32249ea47a56f145a75349f2b0426a (15:46): "Japanese composition is based on the full width design of characters, but strictly following the full width based composition sometimes produces an unbalanced appearance. In such exceptional cases, the appearance as a result of the composition must be given higher priority than the full width design principle. When and how to invoke such exceptional procedures has a direct bearing on the quality of the text layout. In other words, it is
1c32249ea47a56f145a75349f2b0426a (15:46): of how to resolve the conflicts between the principle and the products of it."
1c32249ea47a56f145a75349f2b0426a (15:47): nice. "resolving conflicts between the principle and the products of it"?!
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (15:53): hmm, I want to go read that document now
